resources.string: The Ibovespa operates, at 1:00 pm, down 0.38%, at 104,457 points. The main index of the Brazilian stock market is impacted, mainly, by the performances of American stock markets, which opened in an upward trend but began to fall after the release of macroeconomic data. The yield curve rises, with inflation accelerating, in block. DI contracts expiring in February 2023 rise by 60 basis points. Those for February 2025, 109 basis points. Those for 2029, 47 basis points. The commercial dollar also advanced, rising 0.57%, trading at R$5.672 both when purchasing as for the sale. The future dollar is up 0.81%, at R$5.673. The Brazilian stock market fell 0.80% earlier, but the fall slowed down after Petrobras (PETR3;PETR4) started to rise slightly, following the price of oil. WTI and Brent rise, respectively, 1.36%, to US$ 76.93, and 1%, to US$ 79.79, having gained an upward trend after the US announced that its stock of commodity fell by 3.576 million last week.
